channel.title: Thoughts on Sounds, Music, and Overtones
channel.description: I've had this idea for a while, about changing the way someone or something sounds by adding effects. if you know what overtones are than maybe you get what I'm saying. When you make a note by singing and you change the shape of your mouth you can sometimes get a high pitched sound in addition to the note you sing. I want to see if I could replicate this with instruments. Do you think this is crazy or have you ever seen something like this?:sweat_smile:

item.title: Thoughts on Sounds, Music, and Overtones
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
Revolutionary Production Trick Production Talk
revolutionary for me, anyways so i had this idea around an hour prior to posting this, and testing revealed better results than i had expected https://app.auxy.co/projects/q_r8bQXV79B6bemk8DR5lQ== this is a project with four tracks. the first loops hold the same test melody. the second ones are where i applied the trick. this idea was born from some boring sound science about overtones. how the trick itself works is that the melody is raised by an octave, and then a perfect fifth above that …

Read full topic
item.source: Thoughts on Sounds, Music, and Overtones

item.title: Thoughts on Sounds, Music, and Overtones
item.dc:creator: anon73773654
item.description:
Post Cool Sounds Made With Reverb, Tone, etc Production Talk
So, I just released a new song (https://soundcloud.com/sanabajaj/liftoff), and a lot of the sounds (Gossip, Runner, even Sweeper) I noticed sounded way better when I added some reverb to it, or changed the tone. Do you guys have any tips and tricks about sound editing you want to share? Post 'em here!

Read full topic
item.source: Thoughts on Sounds, Music, and Overtones

item.description:
Silo has a limiting effect if you turn the tone all the way up, here’s playing with octaves reverb and delay…
Not exactly what you are taking about… But it’s still fun

https://app.auxy.co/projects/W1TDJO7nveYTCTzOUh-xPA==

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on Sounds, Music, and Overtones
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
Oooooohhhhh I’m excited to see if anyone’s heard this in auxy. Closest thing I’ve heard is when you set a delay on an instrument and play with the echo by peppering the note with a new note before, during, or after the delay note bounces in

Read full topic
